item.title: Working on Multiple Web Projects with Docker Compose and Traefik
item.description: Docker Compose is a brilliant tool for bringing up local development environments for web projects. But working with multiple projects can be a pain due to clashes. For example, all projects want to listen to port 80 (or perhaps one of the super common higher ones like 8000 etc.). This forces developers to only bring one project up at a time, or hack the compose files to change the port numbers.

item.title: Arduino Programming with Emacs
